thread.title: Forget Kylian Mbappe - this is why Dele Alli is statistically Europe's top young goalscorer
thread.title_full: Forget Kylian Mbappe - this is why Dele Alli is statistically Europe's top young goalscorer

author: Jon Moody
title: Forget Kylian Mbappe - this is why Dele Alli is statistically Europe's top young goalscorer
text:
Are we looking at a future Spurs legend? (Photo: Michael Regan) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Unless you've been living under a rock in the past couple of weeks, you would have heard plenty about a certain Kylian Mbappe. 
His performances have lead to a debut international call-up and intense interest from some of club football's big boys including Real Madrid, Manchester United and Arsenal. 
A lot of the excitement surrounding Mbappe is based around the fact he possesses so many similar traits to Thierry Henry, a man whose footsteps he appears to be following in. Mbappe has the potential to be one of Europe's great strikers (Photo: AFP) 
Fascinated to see how his numbers stack up against other young attacking talent around Europe's big five leagues (England, Spain, France, Italy and Germany), we asked our pals at Opta to do the maths. And the results were very interesting. 
It turns out that with 14 goals, nobody currently aged 21 or under has scored more goals than Tottenham Hotspur's Dele Alli - who is tied with RB Leipzig's Timo Werner. 
That has him two goals above starlet Mbappe so far this season. "Look, I'm a plane!" (Photo: Reuters) Timo Werner is matching Dele goal for goal (Photo: REUTERS) 
Dele leads a list which includes some other enormous talent, such as former Gunner Serge Gnabry and Dortmund's highly-rated Ousmane Dembele. 
Take a look at the full list: Top European league goalscorers - 21 years old or under Opta 
The 20-year-old Englishman's season has gone from strength to strength and he's already a essential part of boss Pochettino's well-oiled Spurs side. And if he keeps his form up, he can safely wave goodbye to his competition in this player table... poll loading Is Dele Alli Europe's best young player? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
